intro: Ribes lentum, commonly known as the common gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with five to seven leaflets and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. Its berries, which are edible, are typically red or yellow when ripe and are used in jams and culinary applications. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and hedgerows.
